references.tryAgainWithDifferentSearchTerm: Try again with a different search term
references.name: Name

profile.offsetDescription: Offset is the difference between your maintenance calories and your daily calorie target. For weight loss, we recommend setting a daily calorie target between 200 to 700 calories below your maintenance level. For muscle gain, we recommend a target between 250 to 450 calories above your maintenance level. Please note that these are general guidelines, and your ideal calorie target may vary depending on your unique body and goals. We encourage you to experiment and adjust your target based on your progress and how you feel.
profile.moderatelyActive: Moderately Active: 3-5 days of moderate exercise
profile.proteinPreference: {{grams}} g per lb of base weight
profile.proteinPreferenceDescription: If you enjoy eating protein-rich foods, you may choose to set a higher protein target. Increasing your protein intake will naturally decrease your carbohydrate intake.
profile.fatPreferenceDescription: If you prefer a diet that's higher in fat, you may choose to set a higher fat target. This will naturally decrease your carbohydrate intake.
